courses.subject: EMBA
courses.title: Family Business Governance
courses.description: This course introduces a framework to guide private and family businesses’ long-term planning. In the course, students seek to understand how entrepreneurs and their family members provide unique assets and contributions leading to the success of the firms, and how various roadblocks challenge the sustainability of the family firm model. It can be realized that the family assets and roadblocks are similar across firms, countries and cultures, and therefore a general framework can be applied to address critical governance decisions including family governance, ownership structures, executive compensation and promotion, and succession and exit, with the aim of improving the well-being of both the firms and the families behind them.
courses.learning_outcomes: This course focuses on institutional environments in Asia and the greater China, yet adopting a global comparative approach. Students will learn to use economic analysis to solve critical family firm governance problems and help their long-term goals and sustainability.
courses.course_syllabus: To be assigned by course teacher
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: To be assigned by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings:
范博宏，《交托之重》，東方出版社 (Beijing, Published in 2014)
Joseph P.H. Fan & Morten Bennedsen, The Family Business Map, Palgrave Macmillan (New York, 2014)

courses.description: This course is the prerequisite of all EMBA courses. It provides a business and management view of the modern corporation. The management aspect of the course considers the changing competitive world, the role of corporations in world development, the values of top management, and the vision needed to plan, organize, lead, and control corporate activities. The business aspect of the course integrates the business functions of the corporation such as marketing, finance, human resources, and production in order to accomplish the corporation's goals.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
courses.learning_outcomes:
Individual
1. Obtain better understanding about oneself.
2. Understand the importance of balancing oneself, family and work.
3. Learn about the “Art of success and happiness”.

Team
1. Strengthen the team communication and relationship.
2. Learn how to achieve better result and become more productive.

Corporation
1. Understand the importance of accountability for all managers to create value for all stakeholders.
2. Know how to coordinate strategy and execution to ensure success.
3. Learn how to lead with cross-functional perspectives.
4. Obtain experience on how to create success through team coordination in analysis and decision-making in a highly ambiguous, uncertain and competitive marketplace.

Society
1. Understand how to maximize oneself social contribution and the process of defining this.
2. Understand social contribution model, and develop a corporate social integration strategy.

courses.subject: EMBA
courses.title: Seminar on Business and Management Issues
courses.description:
This course addresses the latest development in the fields of business and management. Some relevant topics such as electronic business, leadership, corporate governance, social and cultural issues, entrepreneurship, start-ups and IPOs, cross cultural business management, etc. would be incorporated in this seminar course.
The experiential learning components such as field trip/company visit etc. may be offered as course components if deemed necessary by course instructor.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
courses.learning_outcomes: Upon completion of the course, students are expected to be able to understand in depth a wide spectrum of business and management issues and to be able to apply what they have learnt in their daily management and business practices in the future.

courses.subject: EMBA
courses.title: Selected Topics in Business and Management

schedule.class_attributes:
Putonghua and English
All Face-to-Face Teaching

courses.description: This course aims to expose our students to a wide spectrum of global, regional and local business and management issues. To facilitate effective learning, specific topics will be selected for incorporating in this course: examples include trade, economics, technology, finance, market, ventures, politics, corporate governance, management practices, as well as various societal concerns. Throughout this course, lectures, talks, and site visits, in the local and/or international arena, will be conducted to enable students to identify in-depth the gist behind certain selected management and business topics and to come up with insights to help corporations make better decisions in the future. This course consists of an introductory review, followed by an intensive study week in the local and/or international arena. Students have to report their learning and insights with other students after the study week.

courses.subject: EMBA
courses.title: Contemporary Perspectives of Effective Management
courses.description: This course covers the contemporary special topics in management. Depending on the needs and demands in a particular year, the instructor may select to examine in depth on one of the following topics such as: corporate governance in modern management, executive coaching for leadership effectiveness, consultancy in the modern management and management in the Chinese culture and other contemporary special topics.
courses.learning_outcomes: Upon completion of the course, students are expected to be able to understand in depth a wide spectrum of contemporary management issues and to be able to apply effectively what they have learnt to their daily management practices.

courses.subject: EMBA
courses.title: Current Practices for Business Success
courses.description: This course addresses the latest practices in the business arena, with the objective of bringing the current practices and execution in the competitive business world. Depending on the needs and demands in a particular year, the instructor may select to examine in depth on one of the following topics such as: social enterprises, doing business in China, business conflict resolution, application of big data in the contemporary chaotic business environment, global supply chain management and other selected topics.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
courses.learning_outcomes: Upon completion of the course, students are expected to be able to recognize various determinants of business success. Emphasis is also placed on making students being able to apply what they have acquired in the lectures and projects as far as questing for business excellence is concerned.

courses.subject: EMBA
courses.title: Emerging Trends in Business and Management
courses.description: Emerging trends in business and management refer to the new and evolving practices, concepts, and approaches that are gaining prominence in the corporate world. These trends often arise in response to technological advancements, changing consumer behaviors, market dynamics, and societal shifts, etc. Embracing these trends can help organizations stay competitive, adapt to market changes, and foster sustainable growth.
courses.learning_outcomes: The learning outcomes encompass the knowledge, skills, and competencies that students can acquire. By incorporating these learning outcomes, students can stay ahead of emerging trends, leverage new opportunities, and effectively navigate the challenges of the evolving business and management landscape.
courses.course_syllabus: The core content/syllabus should be covered by all sections of the same course and selected topics may be added by individual course teacher. Core content should comprise not less than 50% of the course. It will be assigned by course teacher.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: To be assigned by course teacher.
courses.recommended_readings: To be assigned by course teacher.

courses.description: Adaptive management in evolving environments refers to the practice of adjusting management strategies and approaches to effectively respond to dynamic and changing circumstances. It involves continuously monitoring and assessing the environment, identifying emerging trends and challenges, and making timely adjustments to optimize outcomes. By embracing adaptive management, organizations can anticipate and adapt to emerging trends, capitalize on new opportunities, and mitigate risks. It involves fostering a culture of learning, experimentation, and innovation, etc.
courses.learning_outcomes: The core content/syllabus should be covered by all sections of the same course and selected topics may be added by individual course teacher. Core content should comprise not less than 50% of the course. It will be assigned by course teacher.

courses.title: Global Business and Management Field Study
courses.description: The goal is to develop students with ability to recognise and effectively respond to management issues and the business environment in global contexts. Students will have the opportunity of realising the opportunities and challenges associated with global business development strategy of a corporation.

courses.subject: EMBA
courses.title: Guided Learning in Global Business
courses.description:
The course provides students with the opportunity to study a diverse range of Global Business topics through an independent research project supervised by an experienced instructor. This course provides a platform for students to immerse themselves in various aspects of the global business landscape and foster valuable insights and skills. Students enrolled in this course will benefit from academic guidance and mentorship, enabling them to explore specific areas of interest within the field of Global Business. By engaging in comprehensive research and analysis, students will enhance their knowledge of international markets, global trade, cross-cultural management, and other modern business environments. This course is tailored to equip students with the necessary knowledge and expertise to navigate the diverse challenges present in today's global business environments effectively.

This course enables students to cultivate their research capabilities, analytical skills, and problem-solving acumen. Students could broaden their perspectives and enhance their research methodologies, they will be encouraged to actively engage with their chosen research areas, enhancing their ability to recognise and effectively respond to management issues and the business environment in global contexts.

To enrol in this course, students will be required to seek consent of an instructor after submitting a detailed research proposal outlining the research subject, objectives, and proposed methodology. While students have the flexibility to choose their preferred instructor for guidance, faculty members retain the discretion to accept or decline research students based on the proposal's merit.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing this course, students should be able to:

(1) Gain a thorough understanding of diverse Global Business topics through supervised independent research projects.

(2) Develop essential skills and insights by exploring various aspects of the global business issues.

(3) Enhance research capabilities, analytical skills, and problem-solving acumen to effectively address management issues in global contexts.
courses.course_syllabus:
- Selected topics in global business

- General principle in research methodologies
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: To be assigned by course teacher.
courses.recommended_readings: To be assigned by course teacher.

courses.subject: EMBA
courses.title: Monetary Policy and Global Financial Markets
courses.description: This course provides a systematic review of monetary policy making in major central banks (e.g., the Federal Reserve and the People's Bank of China) and the impact of policy on the global financial markets. In addition, the course offers insights on the latest development of macro financial issues in China and the interactions of these new developments within the global financial system.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Student will be able to:

1. have a systematic review of monetary policy making in major central banks (e.g., the Federal Reserve and the People's Bank of China)
2. gain insights on the latest development of macro financial issues in China
3. understand the interactions of these new developments within the global financial system
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Review of monetary policy making in major central banks
2. Impact of policy on the global financial markets
3. Insights on the latest development of macro financial issues in China
4. Interactions of the new developments within the global financial system
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: To be assigned by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings: To be assigned by course teacher

courses.subject: EMBA
courses.title: Financing Emerging Technology Firms
courses.description:
The course will introduce entrepreneurial process and develop skills critical for starting and succeeding in a new technology venture. It emphasizes the framework and skills needed to identify business ideas, recognize entrepreneurial opportunities, raising and structuring financing and making strategic decisions. It will also provide an overview of the PE/VC industry in China, highlighting recent developments and future trends.
The experiential learning components such as field trip/company visit etc. may be offered as course components if deemed necessary by course instructors.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students will be able to:

1. develop skills critical for starting and succeeding in a new technology venture
2. get hold of the framework and skills needed to identify business ideas, recognize entrepreneurial opportunities
3. get an overview of the PE/VC industry in China, highlighting recent developments and future trends
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Introduction of entrepreneurial process
2. Skills critical for starting and succeeding in a new technology venture
3. Framework and skills needed to identify business ideas and recognize entrepreneurial opportunities
4. Overview of the PE/VC industry in China, highlighting recent developments and future trends
courses.feedback_evaluation: Manatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course
courses.required_readings: To be assigned by course teacher
courses.recommended_readings: To be assigned by course teacher
